qas.question: Who created the Office of Special Operations?
What was the Office of Special Operations initial budget?
Who was the OSO trying to track and gain intelligence on?

context: US army general <a0_0>Hoyt Vandenberg<a0_0/>, the CIG's second director, created the Office of Special Operations (OSO), as well as the <a3_0>Office of Reports and Estimates<a3_0/> (ORE). Initially the OSO was tasked with spying and subversion overseas with a budget of <a1_0>$15 million<a1_0/>, the largesse of a small number of patrons in congress. Vandenberg's goals were much like the ones set out by his predecessor; finding out "everything about <a2_0>the Soviet forces<a2_0/> in Eastern and Central Europe - their movements, their capabilities, and their intentions." This task fell to the 228 overseas personnel covering Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Poland, Czechoslovakia, and Hungary.
